item.title: Builder Financing Requirements: What Lenders Look for in Builder Credentials
item.description: When you apply for construction financing, your lender isn’t just evaluating youâ€”they’re evaluating your builder. Construction loans carry significantly more risk than traditional mortgages because lenders are funding a home that doesn’t exist yet, relying on your builder to complete the project on time, on budget, and to code. If your builder fails to deliver, the lender’s collateral (your partially completed home) could be worth far less than the loan amount.
